result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM - case called.  Defendant Tavis Thurman appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln Hills School.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court notes updated report from the public defender office.  Court questions Ms. Breach.  Response by Ms. Breach - Defendant will be moving Monday to the Dane County Jail for 5-6 months.  Court will adjourn this matter.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:38 PM - case called.  Defendant Tavis Thurman not in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Polzin - Defendant is in custody at LHS.  State notes updated report from the public defender office.  Court notes no victim appeared.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the public defender office time to find counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:32 PM - case called.  Defendant Tavis Thurman appeared by video, in custody from Lincoln Hills.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of this matter.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by the Court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:39 PM - case called.  Defendant Tavis Thurman appeared by video, in custody from Lincoln Hills.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court addresses Defendant regarding appointment of an attorney.  Response by Defendant - has contacted the public defender office and was told he qualifies.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No violent or abusive contact with either victim while in custody.  Upon release from custody no contact with either victim.  No contact with the co-defendants while in custody except for incidental contact while in custody and not to discuss this matter with the co-defendants.  Upon release from custody no contact with the co-defendants.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
